text:
Hey Hannah, I like the video as well :slightly_smiling_face: I took a look on mobile and desktop. Quick design thought: the combination of headers, typeface, and design elements above the fold (on desktop) ends up feeling heavy. It’s hard for me to know what to read first. Might be worth lightening up that area.

Definitely agree with <@U017XD7H4P7> about tightening up your offering. This is something I’m thinking about for my own website: If a visitor walked away with just one takeaway, what would it be? Maybe you can expand that to 3 takeaways, but the point is narrowing your scope and saying who your best-fit audience is. For example:

• I’ll help your new company build the marketing foundation it needs for the next 5 years
• I specialize in growing small businesses by generating more leads with your existing blog
• I handle the marketing content your small business has been putting off, so you can focus on strategy
This isn’t great copy, but you get the idea. And then think about how you can carry that main takeaway through to your newsletter description, testimonials, etc. I hope that helps!

text:
Thank you for the thoughtful and helpful response, <@UJFELMVU1>! You have a great point about it feeling a little too "busy" right at the start. Probably lends into the next area that needs help...

I'm definitely seeing I need to tighten up the offering. I love your idea of the 1 takeaway they should have after they've visited my site! I like your examples.

There are several areas I really enjoy. I need to focus on what I really want to offer!

(and glad the video was a positive aspect!)

Thank you for taking the time to give me your thoughts. So appreciated!
